chargeHist.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

charges.descr: Drive or Operate Vehicle w/o Consent

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tariq Rashad Dillard

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard not in court, in custody.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court for Tariq Rashad Dillard.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for sentencing.  Mr. Dillard NOT produced from custody.  Court rescheduled the matter.  Case adjourned to Branch 2, Rm 635 CH.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard in court, in custody.  Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court for Tariq Rashad Dillard.  Attorney Francesco Mineo in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Counts 1, 3: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

As to Counts 2, 4: Pursuant to negotiations and on State's motion, Court orders charges dismissed, but read-in for sentencing purposes.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Court ordered the defendant remanded into custody.

Court ordered a presentence investigation with a recommendation.  Order for presentence investigation signed and filed.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.

Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court, defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Hearing held via Zoom. Defense requests to set case for projected guilty plea. Case adjourned, Branch 2.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Case scheduled for status conference 07-05-2022 at 8:30 am
Case being heard before Branch 2 today.

Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court, defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard not in court, in custody. Grace Gall on behalf of  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: STW  
Case set for scheduling conference. Defense counsel received discovery and awaiting global offer with pending case in Branch 2. Defense request case set for hearing.  Court orders case for adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard not in court, defendant in custody. Jessica Bellows on behalf of Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Scheduling Conference. Defense counsel does not appear and court adjourned this matter. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2022 at 01:15 pm.

Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court, via zoom, defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard not in court, in custody.  Francesco Mineo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
CASE HELD VIA ZOOM.   Case set for scheduling conference. Defendant has a pending case and parties request matter adjourned. Case adjourned, Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard in court with attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang.  Defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard in custody.  BOTH APPEARED BY VIDEO.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Det Michael Martin.  Court took judicial notice of 21CF5367.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 38.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Manuel Raymundo Galang in court, defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard not in court, in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Defense is newly appointed and needs time to meet with his client. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard not in court, defendant in custody.  Matthew Zisi appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard in court with attorney Joel H. Rosenthal by phone via ZOOM.  Defendant Tariq Rashad Dillard in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tariq Rashad Dillard appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).d  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 4, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
